data.text: Focus is becoming the rarest skill on the planet. Talent, intelligence, marketing, prompting, vibe coding, and whatever else doesn't matter as much as being able to channel your attention for an extended period of time into one useful thing that you want to see in the world.

Self-improvement is a gateway drug into entrepreneurship because you start seeing life as a system you can optimize. You start to believe that if you don't like something about your life, you can change it. And since the source of most people's problems is money, you stop waiting

The ultimate goal is getting paid to be yourself. To solve problems you can't help but solve. To study what you can't pull yourself away from. To eliminate any work that does not challenge you creatively.
https://t.co/2b9xu8HBXY

article.title: How to think like a strategic genius (5d thinking)

data.text: The easiest way to get ahead is to commit to a period of skill development. 6-12 months. Pure focus for 2-4 hours a day. Learning and building. Not just binge watching tutorials, but creating quality projects that you, others, or businesses could actually benefit from. But don't

Grab a notebook.

Write out exactly what you want in your future, don't miss a detail. Then, break it down into goals. Decades, years, months, weeks, and days.

Every day, write down the 3 levers you can pull to make actual progress.

Then, forget about the goals and execute.

I'll be creating a part 2 of this next week, but here's a good place to start:

The primary reason people don't achieve big goals is because they don't realize that the only source of truth is making mistakes. They soak up advice and theory, expecting it to be an exact match to their mind, experience, and situation just to fail once and give up completely.

You don't magically become focused. You practice it. You notice you're distracted and snap out of it, over and over again until it's second nature. Most people have not trained this muscle, and they are not anywhere close to as focused as they think they are.

article.title: The most important skill to learn in the next 10 years

data.text: If you have multiple interests, don't let anyone convince you that you should narrow your focus. You may be confused for a while, but if you stick it out, you will blow past everyone else.

The deeper you fall into a rut the more fuel you have to launch out of it, but also the more excuses you have to stay the same. It is very important that you see through your own bullshit and choose the first option.
The greatest focus hack is to know what you're working on, why you're working on it, when it needs to be done, and how exactly to get it done.

If you work so that you never have to work again, you'll be disappointed when retirement leaves you feeling empty.

Find work that you would do after retirement as early as you can and you'll never feel the need to retire.

Don't try to learn the "best new skills."

Build your own thing. Try to sell it. Fail over and over again. Learn what it means to adapt and iterate. Remove your dependency from others and hunt for your own survival.

You will learn the exact skills you need, and you will learn

As someone who was against AI for a long time, AI is a skill just like any other, and the usefulness of AI increases as you get better at it.

The first time you play a guitar, you literally can't do anything. You sound like shit. But you slowly get better. You can play more

If you want to avoid being replaced, stop worrying about which skills will be relevant 20 years from now.

Nobody has a single clue what those are going to be. The world is changing so rapidly that you can’t even imagine what skills will be valuable in the future.

Instead, you

You don't achieve the life you want then become the "successful" person. You become the person first, which looks cringe until it becomes normal, and success eventually catches up to you. You choose the character you want to play, and only then do the right quests appear.

You easily quit your goals because there's nothing on the line. You don't have a vision for a better life that is so clear that your current life feels like losing if you don't reach it. Secretly most people don't actually want to achieve their goals. They want to impress others

7 more ideas and protocols on how to change:

urls.title: How to fix your entire life in 1 day

data.text: The fastest way to change is to obsessively reflect on what you do every day and do not lie to yourself about what kind of life that is creating.

Your life flips upside down when you realize that "who you are" is a program written by people who were also programmed, and unless you make the painful choice to rewrite that code, most of your thoughts and actions are not beneficial to your future, because they are not yours.

You aren't where you want to be because you don't have the mind of the person who would be in that position. You're exactly where you should be for your level of development, and changing that is within your control.

This goes deeper than you think:
https://t.co/p8dqewSWil

data.text:
Your best ideas will never come from trying to have them.

You must let the creative process play out automatically. You must read more, do more, experience more. Then you must give yourself time to do nothing because that's when your mind will put all the pieces together and

When everyone has an advantage, it is no longer an advantage.

When everyone can learn and create anything at the click of a button, your advantage comes from slowing down, focusing on your craft, doing the right things manually, and acquiring knowledge that is so specific to you

Signs you're on the right track:

Work energizes you
Learning doesn't take effort
Discipline doesn't need to be forced
You think in decades, not days
You're excited to wake up

You relate to very few people, but the relationships you do form are irreplaceable.

If you can't articulate yourself, it will be difficult to get what you want in life.

Customers won't care about your product.

Employers won't give you a raise.

Readers won't give you their attention.

data.text: When your days become too mundane, you need to change something fast. You need chaos. You need novelty. You need the experiences and ideas that inspire you to go on your next quest. Build something new. Rip apart your daily routine. Do anything but the same thing.

If you aren't building something that leads to the life you want, even if it's "only" 30-60 minutes a day, you will by default stay in the same life you're in, building things that allow others to live the life they want. 30 minutes can, in fact, start the snowball.

If you're bored, create something.

Anything.

Software. Designs. Photos. Videos. Writing. A business. A body. A relationship. A mind.

How can you not be excited to wake up when you have the ability to create.
You would learn faster if you actually started building the thing.

You can train your mind to achieve anything you want. Most of what you don't have is no more than a lack of skill, knowledge, action, and the logical sequence of steps it takes to achieve that thing. Deep down, everyone knows this, but their mind was trained by someone else to
